intro: Onohualcoa, commonly known as the "spiny tree," is a member of the Malvaceae family, native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its spiny stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Onohualcoa thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed or dry soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
